intro: Buglossoides arvensis subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as western field scabious, is a perennial flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to thrive in challenging environments.
